p: Clofarabine was reported to be a potent antiretroviral agent. It has shown threefold higher activity against HIV-2 than against HIV-1 ( Beach et al., 2014). Further study on the anti-HIV-1 activity of clofarabine revealed its dual inhibitory function in virus replication. It limits the deoxyribonucleoside triphosphate substrates for the synthesis of viral DNA and directly inhibits the DNA polymerase activity of HIV-1 reverse transcriptase ( Daly et al., 2016).
